title: What is a Cajon? Building wooden instruments. #woodworking #music #percussion     693
description: Just a short video today to show you the wood cajon drum instrument I built. I built it completely from leftover stuff I had. The box(body) is 12x12x18 3/4" plywood. The front(tapa) is 12x18 1/8" Birch plywood. I cut a 4" sound hole on the back 6" from the top. Filled small holes and cracks with wood putty, sanded all really well and rounded the corners on the face. I stained the body dark walnut and then put clear poly over it all. I added rubber feet I already had to the bottom. The natural birch front looks nice with the contrasting dark body. A snare could be added inside as well. A simple fun musical wood project.🙂

title: DIY Woodworking ASMR – From One Giant Log to a Handcrafted Solid Wood Table
description:
From a single raw log to a handcrafted solid wood table.
Pure DIY woodworking ASMR — no talking, no shortcuts, just real craftsmanship.

This video captures the entire DIY woodworking process of transforming one giant log into a handcrafted solid wood table, using traditional techniques and real hands-on skill. Every step is authentic, unfiltered, and focused on craftsmanship — from cutting the tree and chainsaw milling, to shaping, sanding, and finishing the final table.

You’ll experience true woodworking ASMR, featuring only the natural sounds of chainsaws, hand tools, sanding, and solid wood shaping. There is no music and no voice-over, allowing you to fully immerse yourself in the rhythm of real handcrafted woodworking.

Unlike mass factory production, this project follows a traditional log-to-table workflow, highlighting patience, precision, and respect for natural wood grain. The goal is not speed, but quality — turning raw timber into functional, timeless furniture through DIY craftsmanship.

If you love DIY woodworking ASMR, handcrafted furniture, and log-to-furniture builds, this video is for you.

How to Achieve Perfect Edge Finishes Fast | Festool HLC 82
description:
How to Achieve Perfect Edge Finishes Fast with Festool HLC 82.
When speed, precision, and surface quality matter on site, compromise is not an option. The Festool HLC 82 cordless planer is designed for professionals who need flawless results without being tied to a power cord.

Whether you’re chamfering beams, adjusting doors, straightening wallboard edges, or working through renovation challenges, the Festool HLC 82 delivers consistent performance where it counts. Powered by an EC-TEC brushless motor and compatible with Festool’s 18V battery system, it provides strong, reliable cutting power even at maximum chip depth.

What sets the Festool HLC 82 apart is the spiral blade with drawing cut. This design produces a noticeably finer surface finish, dramatically reducing sanding time and delivering professional results straight off the tool. It also operates more quietly, making it ideal for busy construction sites and renovation environments.

With up to 2.5 mm chip removal and a rebate depth of 25 mm, the Festool HLC 82 handles both quick touch-ups and demanding adjustment work. Three integrated V grooves make accurate chamfering fast and repeatable, while the removable chamfer adaptor ensures clean, consistent edges on beams and square timbers.

Flexibility is built in. Dual dust extraction ports allow you to work comfortably from either side, keeping hoses out of the way and improving workflow. Combined with Festool dust extractors, the HLC 82 supports cleaner, safer job sites with excellent chip control even during heavy material removal.

If you’re a carpenter, builder, or renovation professional looking to upgrade your cordless setup, the Festool HLC 82 is built to save time, reduce fatigue, and protect the quality of your work. Fewer mistakes, less rework, and a finish you can stand behind.

Have you used the Festool HLC 82 on site? Let us know your experience in the comments and subscribe for more professional tool insights, real-world tests, and expert woodworking tips.

Clamping Board 1½ x 5½ x 41in 

*If you need more info about the build process, gear, or dimensions, please comment, and I'll answer as soon as I can! Thanks! 

The build starts with a reinforced 2x4 base using pocket hole joinery and 45-degree bracing to eliminate racking. Adjustable leg levelers ensure the workstation sits perfectly flat on an uneven concrete floor, which is critical for precision cuts and long-term stability. The open design and low shelf maximize storage while allowing long lumber to be stored inside the workstation.

The worktop is made from laminated ¾-inch plywood, cut simultaneously with a track saw for perfect alignment. I secure the top using figure-8 fasteners to allow seasonal movement, then finish the edges with birch edge banding for durability and a clean, professional look.

To improve cleanliness and airflow, I build a custom dust collection solution for my older Rockwell table saw using a dedicated panel and magnetic dust ports for quick connection. I also install full overlay cabinet doors using euro-style hinges, walking through precise layout, pilot hole drilling, shimming, and fine adjustment for perfect door alignment.

The workstation also includes a router lift installed flush with the worktop, along with a T-track router fence system for fast, repeatable adjustments and effective dust collection. One of my favorite features is the hard maple T-track clamping station mounted to the end of the bench, giving me powerful and flexible workholding for wide panels, glue-ups, sanding, and assembly work.

This workstation was designed to grow with the shop. It’s rigid, modular, and built for real woodworking — improving workflow, accuracy, and efficiency on every project.

title: 20 New Kreg Tools for Woodworking
description:
Kreg has been on a serious roll, releasing some of the most innovative woodworking tools we’ve seen in years. In this video, we take a deep dive into 20 brand-new and essential Kreg tools designed to make woodworking faster, easier, cleaner, and more precise.
From next-gen pocket-hole jigs and advanced joinery systems to cabinet installation tools, track saws, dust collection upgrades, and clamping solutions, this lineup is built for DIYers, professional woodworkers, cabinet makers, and contractors alike.
Whether you’re building furniture, installing cabinets, working with plywood, or upgrading your workshop setup, these tools can seriously level up your workflow.

🪚 Featured Kreg Tools in This Video
1️⃣ Kreg Track Saw
Kreg’s entry into the track saw market delivers dead-straight, splinter-free cuts in sheet goods. With plunge-cut action, anti-kickback protection, and excellent dust collection, it’s a powerful alternative to a table saw for plywood breakdown and precision cutting.
2️⃣ Kreg 90° Pocket-Hole Driver
Perfect for tight spaces, this right-angle pocket-hole driver makes cabinet repairs, built-ins, and inside-box assembly easy. Compact, magnetic, and incredibly useful.
3️⃣ Kreg Pocket-Hole Jig 720PRO
Built for speed and production, the 720PRO features Automaxx auto-adjust clamping, integrated dust collection, and onboard storage—ideal for high-volume woodworking.
4️⃣ Kreg Dust Separator
This cyclone dust separator captures chips before they hit your shop vac, improving suction, extending filter life, and keeping your workshop cleaner.
5️⃣ Kreg Pocket-Hole Jig XL
Designed for 2x4s and 4x4s, the XL jig creates extra-strong pocket holes for outdoor furniture, decks, and framing projects.
6️⃣ Kreg Pocket-Hole Jig 520PRO
A portable, steel-reinforced pocket-hole jig with auto-adjust clamping, perfect for working directly on large panels or job sites.
7️⃣ Kreg Cabinet Face Frame Clamp
Ensures perfectly flush cabinet face frames, making cabinet installation faster and frustration-free.
8️⃣ Kreg VersaGrip Clamps
Comfortable, strong, and versatile clamps with one-handed operation and non-marring pads.
9️⃣ Kreg MortiseMate Loose Tenon Jig
Create mortise and tenon joints using just a router—no dedicated mortiser required.
🔟 Kreg Cabinet Hardware Jig Pro
Achieve perfectly aligned cabinet knobs and pulls every time—doors and drawers included.
1️⃣1️⃣ Kreg Magnetic Stud Finder
No batteries, no false readings—find studs by locating real fasteners inside the wall.
1️⃣2️⃣ Kreg Drawer Front Mounting System
Get perfect, even drawer gaps with adjustable brackets and precision shims.
1️⃣3️⃣ Kreg Cabinet Installation System
An all-in-one kit for professional cabinet installs—doors, drawers, and hardware.
1️⃣4️⃣ Kreg Pocket-Hole Jig Micro
Ideal for thin stock and small projects, creating discreet, strong pocket holes.
1️⃣5️⃣ Kreg Corner Routing Guide Set
Perfectly round or chamfer corners—no templates needed.
1️⃣6️⃣ Kreg Universal Benches
Build custom workbenches and assembly tables tailored to your shop.
1️⃣7️⃣ Kreg In-Line Clamp
Secure workpieces anywhere on your bench, not just the edges.
1️⃣8️⃣ Kreg Jig K4
A classic, rock-solid pocket-hole jig trusted by woodworkers for years.
1️⃣9️⃣ Kreg Rip-Cut
Turn your circular saw into a precision plywood-cutting machine.
2️⃣0️⃣ Kreg Portable Work Surface
A portable, dog-hole-ready work surface perfect for job sites or small shops.

🔔 Final Thoughts
That wraps up 25 must-have Kreg tools that can seriously improve your woodworking results.

title: Milwaukee's 12V Cordless Planer is a Game Changer
description:
Milwaukee claims their M12 Brushless Planer can deliver corded-like performance and even replace a traditional corded planer — all in a compact 12V package. That’s a bold claim… so I put it to the test.

From aggressive depth cuts to warped boards, OSB abuse, oak, chip control, ergonomics, and real job-site use, this video breaks down what the M12 planer can actually handle — and where it shouldn’t be used.

If you’re a contractor, carpenter, remodeler, or serious DIYer already on the Milwaukee platform, this one might surprise you.

title: My DJI Action A6 8K Camera Setup for Filming Woodworking & Shop Videos
description:
This one is just for the Smart Fam.
Today I’m pulling back the curtain and showing you exactly what goes on behind the scenes at The Smart Woodshop. No woodworking builds in this video. No tool reviews. Instead, I’m walking you through the camera and audio setup I’m using to make these videos clearer, more informative, and more engaging.
I break down my current four-camera system, including the main cam, POV cam, overhead cam, and a head-mounted option that follows where I look. I explain why I’m shooting in 8K and delivering in 4K, how that helps with framing and cropping in post, and why running matching cameras matters for batteries, storage, and syncing.
I also cover my DJI audio setup, how I’m handling interviews, and why consistent sound across videos is something I’m actively working to improve.
This video is also about what’s coming next. I’ve got new tool videos in the pipeline, including the DeWalt Grabo, a new adjustable Trailer Valet hitch, and a follow-up on Router Table 2. And in 2025, my big goal is to come visit your shops, record your setups, and share them with the rest of the Smart Fam.
If you’re into the behind-the-scenes side of content creation, this one’s for you. And if you’re not, feel free to jump ahead and come back for the woodworking.
